results.title: Janeane Garofalo Never Sold Out. What a Relief.
results.abstract: That concept might be the reason her trailblazing stand-up career has been overshadowed; it may also be the reason she’s still so sharp, our critic argues.
des_facet: Mr Show with Bob and David (TV Program)
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Janeane Garofalo after a show in Brooklyn. In the ’90s she played a crucial role in turning stand-up comedy away from the polished, tight sets ready-made for a sitcom or TV appearance.

results.title: Meryl Streep’s One Weird Trick
results.abstract: The dramatic removal of eyeglasses is a cinematic cliché. On Streep, it’s a revelation.

results.title: ‘Where the Crawdads Sing’ Review: A Wild Heroine, a Soothing Tale
results.abstract: Daisy Edgar-Jones stars as an orphaned girl in the marshes of North Carolina in this tame adaptation of Delia Owens’s popular novel.

multimedia.caption: Daisy Edgar-Jones’s Kya is an irresistible if not quite coherent assemblage of literary tropes. Abused and abandoned, she is like the orphan princess in a fairy-tale.
multimedia.copyright: Michele K Short/Columbia Pictures/Sony Pictures Classics

results.title: How the Colorful Costumes of ‘Thor: Love and Thunder’ Were Made
results.abstract: “The Phantom of the Opera,” “Big Trouble in Little China” and an archaeology museum all played a part, the designer Mayes Rubeo explains.

multimedia.caption: Marvel gave the costume designer Mayes Rubeo visual parameters, “which I respect very much,” she said. “But it all goes a little bit out the window” when Taika Waititi is the director.
Marvel gave the costume designer Mayes Rubeo visual parameters, “which I respect very much,” she said. “But it all goes a little bit out the window” when Taika Waititi is the director.

results.title: ‘Persuasion’ Director Thinks Jane Austen Will Be Just Fine
results.abstract: After the backlash to the trailer for her Netflix drama, Carrie Cracknell argues that the movie was made with “openhearted respect” for the author.

results.title: They Loved Volcanoes and Each Other
results.abstract: A new documentary examines the work and lives of the French volcanologists Katia and Maurice Krafft, helped mightily by their own magnificent footage.

multimedia.caption: The Kraffs’ relationship is also the subject of the new documentary.

results.title: Remembering James Caan and His Potent Mix of Swagger and Delicacy
results.abstract: “The Godfather” helped open up a range of roles for the actor that allowed him to play against type and expectation in wonderful ways.

multimedia.caption: James Caan’s career may have risen and fallen, but he brought a greatness to it overall.
James Caan’s career may have risen and fallen, but he brought a greatness to it overall.
James Caan’s career may have risen and fallen, but he brought a greatness to it overall.

results.title: Zawe Ashton Isn’t Here to Be a Victim of Your Projections
results.abstract: The actress was never offered a period piece until “Mr. Malcolm’s List.” She was given 24 hours to decide whether to do it. Now she’s earning raves.

multimedia.caption: “The reality is you can be acting for a long time and not be called to that table,” Zawe Ashton said of the lack of diversity in period dramas.
multimedia.copyright: Heather Sten for The New York Times

results.title: Tom Hanks lo explica todo

results.title: Kevin Spacey Pleads Not Guilty to Sexual Assault
results.abstract: The Oscar-winning actor will face a trial in June 2023 — a rare example of a celebrity #MeToo case reaching that stage in Britain.

results.title: ‘Persuasion’ Review: The Present Intrudes Into the Past
results.abstract: Dakota Johnson smirks her way through a Netflix adaptation of the rekindled romance in Jane Austen’s last novel, our critic writes.

results.title: ‘Anonymous Club’ Review: The Joy of Creation
results.abstract: The Australian singer-songwriter Courtney Barnett goes on a world tour in this music documentary, and finds that a change is needed.

results.title: ‘Costa Brava, Lebanon’ Review: Paradise Tossed
results.abstract: In Mounia Akl’s ambitious debut feature, a family’s attempts to escape the filth of Beirut go awry when the garbage follows them to their doorstep.

results.abstract: As the first Arab Muslim lead in a comic book adaptation, the Egyptian American actor lists the things guiding him as he steps into the spotlight.

results.title: ‘Murina’ Review: Hunting for Independence on Her Terms
results.abstract: In this coming-of-age tale set off the rugged Croatian coast, a teenage girl strives to catch elusive eels, one of the movie’s hardworking metaphors.

results.title: ‘Thor: Love and Thunder’ Review: A God’s Comic Twilight
results.abstract: The director Taika Waititi injects antic silliness, once again, into this Marvel franchise starring Chris Hemsworth, who swings a mighty hammer and flexes mightier muscles.
